00024 #ifndef _SAXPARSER_HPP_
00025 #define _SAXPARSER_HPP_
00026 
00027 #include "utility/misc/Export.hpp"
00028 #include "boost/lexical_cast.hpp"
00029 #include "boost/iostreams/positioning.hpp"
00030 #include <iosfwd>
00031 #include <string>
00032 #include <map>
00033 
00034 
00035 namespace pwiz {
00036 namespace minimxml {
00037 
00038 
00039 ///
00040 /// An extended SAX interface for custom XML stream parsing.
00041 ///
00042 /// Use cases:
00043 /// - read a single element
00044 /// - read a single element, aborting on a specified tag
00045 /// - delegate handling of a sub-element to another handler 
00046 ///
00047 namespace SAXParser {
00048 
00049 
00050 /// SAX event handler interface.
00051 class Handler
00052 {
00053     public:
00054 
00055     /// Handler returns the Status struct as a means of changing the parser's behavior.  
00056     struct Status
00057     {
00058         enum Flag 
00059         {
00060             Ok,       // ok, continue parsing the stream
00061             Done,    // abort immediately
00062             Delegate  // delegate this element to the specified Handler [startElement() only] 
00063         };
00064 
00065         Flag flag;
00066         Handler* delegate; // valid iff (flag == Delegate)
00067 
00068         Status(Flag _flag = Ok, 
00069                Handler* _delegate = 0)
00070         :   flag(_flag), delegate(_delegate)
00071         {}
00072     };
00073 
00074     typedef std::map<std::string,std::string> Attributes;
00075     typedef boost::iostreams::stream_offset stream_offset; 
00076 
00077     virtual Status processingInstruction(const std::string& name,
00078                                          const std::string& data,
00079                                          stream_offset position) {return Status::Ok;}
00080 
00081     virtual Status startElement(const std::string& name,
00082                                 const Attributes& attributes,
00083                                 stream_offset position) {return Status::Ok;}
00084 
00085     virtual Status endElement(const std::string& name,
00086                               stream_offset position) {return Status::Ok;}
00087 
00088     virtual Status characters(const std::string& text,
00089                               stream_offset position) {return Status::Ok;}
00090 
00091     virtual ~Handler(){}
00092 
00093     protected:
00094 
00095     template <typename T>
00096     void getAttribute(const Attributes& attributes,
00097                       const std::string& name,
00098                       T& result)
00099     {
00100         Attributes::const_iterator it = attributes.find(name);
00101         if (it != attributes.end()) 
00102             result = boost::lexical_cast<T>(it->second);
00103     }
00104 };
00105 
00106 
00107 ///
00108 /// Extract a single XML element from the istream, sending SAX events to the handler.
00109 ///
00110 /// Behavior:
00111 ///
00112 /// - Parser returns when it completes reading of the first element it encounters.
00113 ///
00114 /// - Parser returns immediately if the Handler returns Status::Done when handling an event.
00115 ///
00116 /// - On startElement(), Handler may delegate handling to a sub-Handler, which will receive
00117 ///   the same startElement() event.  The sub-Handler pointer will remain on the parser's 
00118 ///   Handler stack until it handles the corresponding endElement().  Caution: The sub-Handler 
00119 ///   pointer must remain valid while it is on the Handler stack, so it cannot point to
00120 ///   a local object that goes out of scope when Handler::startElement() returns. 
00121 ///
00122 /// Notes:
00123 /// - Start tags with end marker '/' generate two events, e.g. <br/> will generate events
00124 ///   startElement("br", ...) and endElement("br").
00125 ///
00126 PWIZ_API_DECL void parse(std::istream& is, Handler& handler);
00127 
00128 
00129 } // namespace SAXParser 
00130 } // namespace minimxml 
00131 } // namespace pwiz
00132 
00133 
00134 #endif // _SAXPARSER_HPP_
